adjective.description: Existing or occurring at the beginning.

noun.description: The first letter of a name or word, typically a person's name or a word forming part of a phrase.
examples: they carved their initials into the tree trunk

verb.description: Mark or sign (a document) with one's initials in order to authorize or validate it.

origin: Early 16th century: from Latin initialis, from initium beginning, from inire go in, from in- into + ire go.
